titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Peter A. Wick Collection of J. J. Grandville
titlestmt.author: by Beinecke Staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Friday March 22, 2019 at 03:02

did.unittitle: Peter A. Wick Collection of J. J. Grandville

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: A collection of sketches and prints by French artist J. J. Grandville.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Peter A. Wick (Yale 1943) and Kathleen Wick, 1995-2003.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two series: I. Drawings, 1829-1846. II. Prints, 1827-1835.

bioghist.head: Peter Arms Wick (1920-2004)
bioghist.p: Peter Arms Wick (1920-2004, Yale 1943), American author and bibliophile, held curatorial positions in the Prints and Drawings Department of the Museum of Fine Arts Boston, and at Harvard University's Fogg Art Museum and Houghton Library.

bioghist.head: J. J. Grandville (1803-1847)
bioghist.p: J. J. Grandville (1803-1847), French caricaturist, born Jean Ignace Isidore Gérard, who. He specialized in political and social satire presented in popular journals, books, and collections of fables illustrated with anthropomorphic animals and insects

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Peter A. Wick Collection of J. J. Grandville. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection includes materials previously identified by the following call numbers: Uncat MS Vault 737, Uncat MS Vault 863, Uncat MSS 68.

relatedmaterial.head: Associated Materials
relatedmaterial.p: J. J. Grandville, Grande course au clocher académique (GEN MSS 1325), Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection consists of twenty-eight drawings and forty lithographs by the French artist and caricaturist J. J. Grandville. The drawings are ink, graphite, and watercolor on paper, and are sketches that he created prior to the final drawings for illustrations for the books Fables de Florian , Jérôme Paturot , Les Métamorphoses du jour , Petites misères de la vie humaine , Scènes de la vie privée et publique des animaux , and Voyages de Gulliver dans des contrées lointaines . The lithographs are images published in the journals La Caricature and Le Charivari , with a separate porfolio of ten prints titled Chaque âge a ses plaisirs .

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Peter A. Wick Collection of J. J. Grandville is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

did.unittitle: Drawings

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series I is arranged by title of publication, with unidentified drawings filed at the end.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains twenty-eight drawings and sketches for book illustrations.

did.unittitle: Prints

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The series contains forty-one lithographs, primarily from the journal La Caricature .

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Series II is arranged alphabetically by title of publication.

did.unittitle: Chaque âge a ses plaisirs (Paris: Chez Gihaut, 1827)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series of ten lithographs titled "Les amusemens de l'enfance" (3 pl.),"Les plaisirs de la jeunesse" (3 pl.), "Les jouissances de l'âge mûr" (3 pl.), and "Les passe-temps de la vieillesse."
